name: UIPageViewControllerDelegate
desc: The delegate of a page view controller must adopt the UIPageViewControllerDelegate protocol. These methods allow the delegate to receive a notification when the device orientation changes and when the user navigates to a new page. For page-curl style transitions, the delegate can provide a different spine location in response to a change in the interface orientation.

items.name: func pageViewController(UIPageViewController, willTransitionTo: [UIViewController])
items.desc: Called before a gesture-driven transition begins.

items.name: func pageViewController(UIPageViewController, didFinishAnimating: Bool, previousViewControllers: [UIViewController], transitionCompleted: Bool)
items.desc: Called after a gesture-driven transition completes.

items.name: func pageViewController(UIPageViewController, spineLocationFor: UIInterfaceOrientation) -> UIPageViewController.SpineLocation
items.desc: Returns the spine location for the given orientation.

items.name: func pageViewControllerSupportedInterfaceOrientations(UIPageViewController) -> UIInterfaceOrientationMask
items.desc: Returns the complete set of supported interface orientations for the page view controller, as determined by the delegate.

items.name: func pageViewControllerPreferredInterfaceOrientationForPresentation(UIPageViewController) -> UIInterfaceOrientation
items.desc: Returns the preferred orientation for presentation of the page view controller, as determined by the delegate.
